sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Gaussian elimination
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using Gaussian elimination: 

2x + 4y - 6z = 12 

-4x + 2y + 3z = -18 

7x - 5y + z = 5
message_2:
First, we will write the given system of linear equations in the form of an augmented matrix:

```
|  2   4  -6 |  12 |
| -4   2   3 | -18 |
|  7  -5   1 |   5 |
```

Step 1: Swap Row 1 and Row 2 to make the pivot element in the first row nonzero:

```
| -4   2   3 | -18 |
|  2   4  -6 |  12 |
|  7  -5   1 |   5 |
```

Step 2: Divide Row 1 by -4 to make the pivot element 1:

```
|  1  -0.5 -0.75 |  4.5 |
|  2   4    -6   | 12  |
|  7  -5     1   |  5  |
```

Step 3: Replace Row 2 with Row 2 - 2 * Row 1 and Row 3 with Row 3 - 7 * Row 1 to make the elements below the pivot element zero:

```
|  1  -0.5 -0.75 |  4.5  |
|  0   5   -5    |  3    |
|  0  -1.5  6.25 | -26.5 |
```

Step 4: Divide Row 2 by 5 to make the pivot element 1:

```
|  1  -0.5 -0.75 |  4.5  |
|  0   1   -1    |  0.6  |
|  0  -1.5  6.25 | -26.5 |
```

Step 5: Replace Row 1 with Row 1 + 0.5 * Row 2 and Row 3 with Row 3 + 1.5 * Row 2 to make the elements below and above the pivot element zero:

```
|  1   0  -1.25 |  4.8  |
|  0   1   -1   |  0.6  |
|  0   0   4.25 | -27.4 |
```

Step 6: Divide Row 3 by 4.25 to make the pivot element 1:

```
|  1   0  -1.25 |  4.8  |
|  0   1   -1   |  0.6  |
|  0   0   1    | -6.447|
```

Step 7: Replace Row 1 with Row 1 + 1.25 * Row 3 and Row 2 with Row 2 + Row 3 to make the elements above the pivot element zero:

```
|  1   0   0    |  4.059 |
|  0   1   0    | -5.847 |
|  0   0   1    | -6.447 |
```

Now, we can read the solution directly from the matrix:

x = 4.059
y = -5.847
z = -6.447
